extracted_information: The HyperEVM dual-block architecture features a mempool that is an onchain state relative to the umbrella L1 execution. This mempool is divided into two independent mempools, each sourcing transactions for one of the two block types. These block types are interleaved with a unique, increasing sequence of EVM block numbers. The onchain mempool implementation enforces a limit of accepting only the next 8 nonces per address, and transactions older than 1 day within the mempool are automatically pruned.
